title: Second Sight Medical Products posts
text:
SYLMAR, Calif. (AP) _ Second Sight Medical Products Inc. (EYES)   loss of $7.4 million in its fourth quarter.
On a per-share basis, the Sylmar, California-  13 cents. Losses, adjusted for non-recurring gains, were 14   maker of camera-based retinal implants posted revenue of $3.1   that its loss narrowed to $28.5 million, or 53 cents per share. Revenue was reported as $8 million.
